Projects.title: Very Stable Nuclear Reactor That Definitely Won't Blow Up
Projects.description:
Ludum Dare 49 Game Jam Theme: Unstable For this game jam we (2-person team) made a nuclear power builder game, inspired by Cities Skyline and the Bigger Reactors mod from minecraft. The goal is to build your reactor piece by piece, then use or sell your power for cash or research to continue your expansion.
Ludum Dare Submission | Play

Projects.title: ASP.NET Portfolio Website
Projects.description: This website! The technologies I have used are: ASP.NET Core, Razor, CSS + Bootstrap and JSON. The website should be fully responsive to different aspect ratios and resolutions. This projects page is generated from a JSON file and converted into HTML, alternating the side of the image and text if the viewport is big enough. You can find the source on GitHub

Projects.title:
Ludum Dare 48 Jam: 
DiggyDiggyMole
Projects.description:
Game created for the latest Ludum Dare as a team of 2 over 72 hours. Goal is to go as far as you can and pick up gold for upgrades along the way to help get further.
Ludum Dare Submission | Play

Projects.title: Virtual Reality Terrain Editor
Projects.description: Create and export terrain, all in Virtual Reality! Key Features: - World space menus to suit VR - Different brush types and sizes - Exporting to .OBJ - Left/Right handed modes You can find the source on GitHub.

Projects.title: Royal Navy Firefighting Project
Projects.description:
As a group of 5, we were tasked by the Royal Navy to develop a first-response firefighting training/practice tool in VR.

I was tasked with implementing all VR elements and interactions, the dynamic hoses, importing 3D models (as we used Collaborate and ran out of seats), and various small things.

As this project was for the Royal Navy, source code is unavailable.

Projects.title: Dungeon Generation Demo
Projects.description: As part of my final year project, I developed a dungeon generation tool that utilises: - Growing Tree - Delaunay Triangulation - Minimum Spanning Tree The demo has some parameters that can be adjusted to create different results (on top of the already random nature of it of course!). You can find the source on GitHub.

Projects.title: A* Pathfinding Demo
Projects.description: My implementation of A* and flocking behaviours to control RTS units, including weighted tiles (Red tiles bad, green tiles good!). You can find the source on GitHub.

Projects.title: El' Sacrificio
Projects.description:
A mobile game made for the 2019 UOP game jam as a team of 4.
Functions very similar to a clicker game but with additional steps (for better or worse).

The goal is to sacrifice animals to your god and collect the blood, and in return he grants you the ability to spend blood to upgrade and earn more blood!

Projects.title: Replevy'in
Projects.description: A game jam project completed in a team of 3. You play as David L. Levy and save the children from kidnappers, bullys and general wandering off alone. Keep them out of harm's way by throwing them into a safe area! Though throwing them can be a little rough... You can find the source on GitHub.

Projects.title: Space Trash
Projects.description: A game made as part of my course at the University of Portsmouth. We were given no guidance other than 'Make a game using C++ and DX11'. This is the result of that statement. A spaceship flying through a tunnel and collecting green trash cubes. It even has sound, albeit very annoying! You can find the source on GitHub.

Projects.title: Propbox
Projects.description: Named propbox to shorten Prop Sandbox (which would be generous), this game is just a demonstration of my own implementation of Quaternions. I gamified it by hiding objects in a maze and have you match rotation, position and scale to win. The positions of the objects in the maze changes each time, so good luck finding them without using the cheat codes! You can find the source on GitHub.
